intro: Satanocrater somalensis, commonly known as the Somali devil's mouth, is a flowering plant native to Somalia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spiny leaves and striking, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its flowers are pollinated by specific insects, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
